comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: This may be Mrs. Arthur Carroll, [note spelling] 64 East Seventy-seventh Street, New York City. Mrs. Annie Livingston Best, daughter of Mrs. Clermont Livingston Best, married Arthur Carroll, the elder son of General Howard Carroll and Mrs. Carroll of Carrollcliffe, Tarrytown, in September, 1910 in New York City. Arthur Carroll was a 1904 graduate of Columbia University. Annie Livingston Best had previously married Elizur Yale Smith in November, 1907, however they divorced the following June and she resumed using her maiden name. Elizur Yale Smith spent some time in jail in Kingston, NY, in 1911, after defrauding hotels with bad checks. Below is a photo of Arthur Carroll's boyhood home: "Castle on the Hudson"      by Benjamin Haas Mrs. Annie Carroll and Arthur divorced five years later, and she remarried, for the third time, W. Sackett Duell of Philadelphia, in January, 1920. —Compiled from The New York Times [1] [2] [3] [4] [5] [6]

comment._content: Photo appears to have been taken at Newport, R.I.
